project.teaser: Wind and sun will be central energy sources of a climate neutral Europe 2050, bringing with them the need to balance weather dependent differences between supply and load. Conventional gas turbines can fulfill this task also for longer periods even well as they can stabilize...
project.objective:
Wind and sun will be central energy sources of a climate neutral Europe 2050, bringing with them the need to balance weather dependent differences between supply and load. Conventional gas turbines can fulfill this task also for longer periods even well as they can stabilize the grid with their capability of quick start/stop. However, their efficiency is limited and – even if burning climate neutral hydrocarbons – they still produce local emissions. HERMES overcomes these limitations and advances gas turbine technology to the future-proof level by creating a reliable, flexible, zero-emission solution for energy supply with long term impact at EU level.
HERMES develops and assesses the first highly efficient closed-loop supercritical zero emission energy system. It is based on directly fired supercritical gas turbine engine operating on locally synthesized renewable liquid and gaseous fuels (e.g. methanol or hydrogen) coupled with decentralized carbon capture utilization and storage (CCUS). The carrier medium is highly dense supercritical carbon dioxide or xenon demanding less compression power. Therefore, and because of operating at high pressure conditions (above 150 bar), the system achieves significantly higher efficiency (above 65%) than today’s gas turbines. By utilizing pure oxygen for fuel oxidation, and by capturing bulky flow of exhaust products (H2O and/or CO2) and reusing them for fuel synthesis, the system produces virtually no pollutants. A detailed assessment of the HERMES approach will be done using experimental and computational approaches and dynamic simulation tools including digital twins and machine learning.
The 36-month project will be realized by an 11-partner consortium including 3 SMEs with expertise in renewable energy, combustion, techno-economics and socio-political science. Hermes will pave the way to a major breakthrough in the understanding of fundamentals of combustion in supercritical fluids with zero emission of any pollutants.
project.title: Highly Efficient Super Critical ZERO eMission Energy System
project.keywords: Zero emission closed-loop renewable system, supercritical fluids, high pressure gas turbines, decentralized fuel synthesis with CCUS, techno-economic, environmental, social, policy assessment

result.title: Final Exploitation Plan
result.description: Final Exploitation Plan: Report regarding the Final Exploitation & IPR plan applications with outlined options on the possible synergies between the HERMES system and other initiatives and including options for collaboration and knowledge sharing.

result.title: Database with flame and fundamental combustion properties
result.description: Database with flame and fundamental combustion properties: Tabularized data for examined fuels: laminar burning velocities liquid droplet atomization in supercritical medium, including ignition conditions, fuel compactivity under actual system conditions (HiL tests).

result.title: C&D Plan
result.description: C&D Plan: Communication and Dissemination Plan including visual identity and public website of the HERMES project, as well as, the identification of the dissemination channels to maximize the scientific and industrial awareness.

result.title: Sorbent characterization
result.description: Sorbent characterization: Report on the properties of the sorbet and its characterisation based on the lab scale experiments

result.title: Revised C&D Plan - M18
result.description: Revised C&D Plan - 2: Communication and Dissemination Plan with an updated targeted groups, dissemination topics and adequate methods and tools .

result.title: Renewable fuel sizing & storage systems
result.description: Renewable fuel sizing & storage systems: Database of case studies for renewable fuel sizing and storage systems with performance analysis for optimization of integrated energy systems.

result.title: Capacity building material
result.description: Capacity building material: Training material and report on capacity building activities via workshops, e-learning platform, conferences, publications, etc.

result.title: Renewable fuel value chains
result.description: Renewable fuel value chains: Report on the analysis of the value chain for the entire HERMES system, starting from the renewable fuel generation to the entire system operation. The report will include the preliminary stakeholder analysis and EU policies

result.title: Validated LES code
result.description: Validated LES code: Report on validation of the Large Eddy Simulation CFD code including reduced combustion chemistry models for pressures up to 150 bar.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - HERMES (Highly Efficient Super Critical ZERO eMission Energy System)
result.teaser: Gas Turbine engines (GT) are a vital part of the backbone of EU power generation and will continue to hold a major role in centralized and decentralized energy supply. They have numerous advantages for power generation, i.e., efficiency, reliability, unique ability to vary...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
